fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to reindex JIRA fails with the below exception. This does not fail for *all* issues, only a couple. It also causes JIRA Agile's upgrade tasks to fail, as tracked in GHS-10348.

h3. Environment

* Java 7

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with problematic data.
# Install JIRA Agile and upgrade.

h3. Expected Results

The reindex completes without error.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2014-02-04 11:31:28,768 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 ERROR admin 685x278x1 o72kxu 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED.  Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/comments, /Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/issues, /Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/changes]
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 3 errors
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:147)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doIndexIssuesInBatchMode(DefaultIndexManager.java:877)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doStopTheWorldReindex(DefaultIndexManager.java:844)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:307)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:267)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy140.reIndexAll(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.doReindex(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.call(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:374)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:250)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
{noformat}

Tracking back into the logs reveals that exceptions were thrown during the indexing (the timestamp on this log is different however it's the same problem):

{noformat}
2014-03-08 21:07:32,716 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN captain.planet 1267x112x1 h86sjy 74.57.203.161,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
{noformat}

h3. Notes

It is important to note that indexing _mostly_ finishes. It seems to fail for one or more issues that throws that exception.

h3. Workaround

Switching to Java 6 will allow the issues to be indexed. Please note that Java 6 is not supported in later versions of JIRA as per [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms].

fields.description:
Current situation:
* I couldn't load JIRA Chart from JAC properly recently, it fails randomly.
* I verified it against a test OD instance and it works properly.

My best guess is that one node of JAC generates a resource (one time access image) and return xml with the link to that resource. Browser then uses that link to retrieve resource and randomly hits the second node instead of the first node which doesn't contain the resource. 404 then returned.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37808].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Add the Filter Results gadget.
# Choose a filter, and save it.
# Click the cog on an issue in the list, and choose "Add Field"

You're redirected and the server gives a HTTP 400.

Probably what we want to do is get rid of the option form the menu, rather than fix it. This option makes no sense in this context. If nobody complains in a few months and we haven't fixed it, we should just resolve this issue; fixing it would be a waste of time given the uselessness of it.

fields.description:
When JIRA XML backup is taken (from OnDemand as well as hosted), the avatar mappings in the backup files are not proper with the following two issues:

# The value of {{propertyentry.entity_id}} should be {{app_user.id}} so that the database join works.
# The value of {{propertyentry.entity_name}} should be 'ApplicationUser' and not 'ExternalEntity'.

h2.How to reproduce the problem
# Set up a JIRA OnDemand or hosted instance.
# Create a few users and add custom user avatars for these users.
# Export XML backup using Administration -> Backup data to XML.
# Set up a new JIRA system for importing the backup.
# Use the generated backup file for restoring this system.
# Extract and copy the {{avatars}} folder from the backup ZIP file into {{[$JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/data}} of the new installation.
# Navigate to Administration->User Management->Users to check if the avatars for the users are displayed correctly.

h2.Expected Result
The custom user avatars are displayed correctly.

h2.Observed Results
The custom user avatars are not displayed. Instead the default user avatar is displayed.

h2.Workaround
(!) This workaround involves executing SQL queries to modify the database, which is not supported by Atlassian. It is recommended to take an XML backup of the JIRA instance as a precautionary measure as well as to execute this workaround on a test instance to verify that there are no unforeseen side effects.

The following SQL queries should be executed to fix the mappings and values:

# Stop JIRA.
# Execute the following SQL query to update the user to avatar mapping:
*MySQL*
{code}
update propertyentry, propertynumber, avatar, app_user set propertyentry.entity_id=app_user.id where propertyentry.id = propertynumber.id and propertynumber.propertyvalue=avatar.id and app_user.lower_user_name = avatar.owner and property_key='user.avatar.id';
{code}
# Execute the following SQL query to set the avatar type correctly.
*MySQL*
{code}
update propertyentry, propertynumber, avatar set propertyentry.entity_name='ApplicationUser' where propertyentry.id=propertynumber.id and avatar.id=propertynumber.propertyvalue and propertyentry.property_key = 'user.avatar.id' and avatar.owner is not null;
{code}
# Start JIRA.
fields.summary: Mapping of avatar data not correct during export or backup of JIRA data

fields.description:
The behaviour can be observed when comparing JIRA 6.2.x with JIRA 5.2.11.

Steps to reproduce:
# make sure JIRA 6.2.x and JIRA 5.2.11 has the exact same data
# create same filter in both instances
# add Filter Result gadget into the instances using the filter created in step 2.
# access the dashboard and the JIRA 6.2.1 will be slower than JIRA 5.2.11
(!) the differences in speed is not obvious for small instance. In large instances and gadgets are used heavily, the response is obvious. In some cases, JIRA 6.2.1 with the same data as JIRA 5.2.11 it take 3 times longer to load the exact same dashboard.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37794].
  {panel}

h6. Overview
The list of versions gives the options to move an entry up or down the list as required. Previously, the browser would automatically scroll the page when you drag a version to the top or bottom of the screen. This no longer happens. It forces users to move a version to the correct location in numerous small steps.
!drag_version.JPG|thumbnail!

h6. Workaround
By using a mouse wheel to scroll the page whilst dragging a version but this obviously isn't possible on mobile devices. 

h6. Proposed solution
Can the view be set to scroll again when versions are moved (via drag and drop)?

fields.description:
When copying text from an HTML formated Outlook message into a comment to a JIRA ticket, we get the error shown in the screen shot.

We debugged this the following way:
1. Copy text into Windows Editor; this shows some control characters.
2. Delete control and - just to be shure - other special characters.
3. Copy this clean text into the comment in JIRA - all is fine.

We did not check wether the same happens if you copy the control characters into other issue fields like description or summary.

fields.description:
Performing a JIRA upgrade to version 6.2.1 and importing an XML backup of a previous version (6.1.4), the following Error and Warning messages appear in JIRA log:
{code}
2014-03-25 18:21:15,309 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "DEC_PROP_1" of table "JQUARTZ_SIMPROP_TRIGGERS" of entity "JQRTZSimplePropTriggers" is of type "DECIMAL(13,4)" in the database, but is defined as type "NUMERIC(13,4)" in the entity definition.

2014-03-25 18:21:15,310 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "DEC_PROP_2" of table "JQUARTZ_SIMPROP_TRIGGERS" of entity "JQRTZSimplePropTriggers" is of type "DECIMAL(13,4)" in the database, but is defined as type "NUMERIC(13,4)" in the entity definition.

2014-03-25 18:21:15,320 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "MISFIRE_INSTR" of table "JQUARTZ_TRIGGERS" of entity "JQRTZTriggers" has a column size of "SMALLINT(5)" in the database, but is defined to have a column size of "SMALLINT(2)" in the entity definition.
{code}
_And_
{code}
2014-04-07 08:53:35,987 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "SEARCH_FIELD" of table "audit_log" of entity "AuditLog" is of type "VARCHAR(255)" in the database, but is defined as type "LONGTEXT" in the entity definition.
{code}

Having a look into the database, tables starting with *jquartz_* seem to be new in JIRA 6.2.1 (not available in JIRA 6.2). Looking into details:
* JQUARTZ_SIMPROP_TRIGGERS has column type of *decimal(13,4)* for the mentioned columns
!simprop_triggers.png|thumbnail!
* JQUARTZ_TRIGGERS has column size of *smallint(2)* instead of SMALLINT(5) for the mentioned column
!triggers.png|thumbnail!

Since the tables are new and the messages are not consistent, customers are hesitant in moving on with using JIRA 6.2.1. Some clear explanations of these tables' usage as well as real indications of the messages are highly appreciated.

fields.description:
We set up a collector to create bugs from an email account at our company.  I noticed that the bug number does not increment contiguously as would be expected (BUG-3, BUG-4, BUG-5, etc.)  Instead it seems to vary wildly.  Real issues: TEMP-1428, TEMP-1431, TEMP-2672, TEMP-3019, TEMP-4987, TEMP-5392, TEMP-7474, etc...

The collector was doing this in the main project so I pointed it to the temporary project to quit burning through insane amounts of issue numbers.  No one is manually creating issues in the project so there's no other way to account for this behavior.  I've tried to browse to some of the issues in between (TEMP-7300) but it does not exist.

The run up from TEMP-1428 to TEMP 7592 was only 5 days (March 29 to April 2).

I'm not filing this as a support request because I can't see any possible reason this would ever be desired behavior regardless of configuration.
fields.summary: Collector creates non-contiguous issues

h3. Expected behavior:
The link should have been created with no error message and the link to the Confluence page should point to the Display URL defined at the application link configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA and Confluence (with any proxy or ssl integraton);
# Set the Base URL for both applications;
# Create the application link using the URL defined as the Base URL;
# After creating the application link, edit the _Display URL_ of Confluence to a different URL pointing to the same server (i.e.: Server IP), as in the following example:
!applink.png|thumbnail!
# Create the link to a Confluence page.

h3. Workaround:
Use the [link to web page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoanywebpageURL] functionality, instead of the [link to Confluence page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Linking+Issues#LinkingIssues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage].
fields.summary: Link to Confluence page does not work when Display URL is different than Application URL

fields.description:
In Jira 3.13 when uploading an attachment from a CIFS share, certain users are getting: error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.MultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null)

I tried stopping Tomcat and deleting the work and temp directories, then starting Jira up, but that didnt resolve the issue.  If they copy the same file to their Desktop first, and then upload it as an attachment, they are able to create the issue successfully.
fields.summary: Error when uploading attachment from CIFS Share

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37777].
  {panel}

I have configured my Jira account to send emails. When someone mentions me in a comment or description, usually the email contains the text "x commented on", and only sometimes does it contain the text "x mentioned you".

I rely on the "x mentioned you" to filter incoming email using inbox rules. If it doesn't contain that phrase, it skips my inbox. 

The behavior described above means that email updates for most comments where I am mentioned by name skip  my inbox. Can it be fixed that such emails always contain "x mentioned you"? 

Even more usefull would be if emails from Jira contain tags that can be used for inbox rules.

Thank you for considering!
fields.summary: Always use the phrase "mentioned you" in emails for comments or changes that mention me

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37771].
  {panel}

I was trying to do a bulk change on a filtered list of over 50 issues.
I updated the first page, selecting 'current page' and performed the update.
When I stepped to the second page and again selected 'current page' for the bulk change, the list of issues I was shown was the first page again which had already been updated.
The only way to update more than the first 50 issues was to select the 'All <n> issues' option.

Repeatable every time.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.1.7 Bulk Change 'current page' only allows the first page to be updated

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an document or excel with some contents to JIRA issue
# Open IE 10 and navigate to the JIRA issue
# Open the attachment with left click
# In the dialog, Choose Open and the document would open from Microsoft Office directly
# In the document, choose _enable editing_ or _enable printing_.

h4. Expected Result

The document contents would present nicely.


h4. Actual Result:

A login screen was shown in the word or excel:
!login_screen.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround:
* Disable protected view in Microsoft Office 2010.
* Save the file to a folder in the workstation and open it from there. Do not open the file directly from the browser.

h4. Environment:
* Windows 7
* Office 2010
fields.summary: Word or Excel Attachment Gets Login Screen Content If Open From Internet Explorer Directly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37759].
  {panel}

At the moment, the order of nodes in a Workflow XML Export seems somewhat arbitrary between nodes at the same level. This makes it difficult to compare two workflows (between a test and a 'live' workflow, for example). 

The most common issues for me are with actions and arguments.
* Not sure if it is sufficient to order actions just by ID or if order by name, then ID is better.
* Sorting args by name "<arg name=" would also help.

if I copy a workflow and then export the original and the copy to XML, I expect to see the same output (except for the nodes with description and date at the top ). This is not the case for us in JIRA 6.1.5.
fields.summary: Predictive export of Workflow XML

fields.description:
The STOP WATCHING feature no longer works. 
When clicking the link, the user is removed as a watcher. 
However, when refreshing the page, the user is added back as a watcher. 
This issue was discovered in the DOWNLOAD version of JIRA. 
An internet search has led to the discovery that the issue has also occured in the ON DEMAND version.
fields.summary: Removing Watchers

fields.description:
Many gadgets on one dashboard may lead to performance problems in a high traffic / concurrent access scenario. 

It becomes worse when those gadgets require expensive searches and post processing.

h3. Reproduction Steps

1. To make things easier please use slowmo for such url:

/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr

and give it 60 seconds delay.

2. Create dashboard with 8 gadgets

3. In server.xml change maxThreads to 8 and restart jira

4. Open dashboard page in one tab and then in another. Dashboard should not load in second one before all gadgets finish loading in first one.

Warning, over-communication: no one would want to change maxThreads to 8 on production environment, but this is example configuration to makie it easier to reproduce. On production environment you would get x10 more threads but also x100 more concurrent users and that's when this problem pops up.

Rendering gadgets which are not visible also means a huge footprint for OD.

h3. Suggested solution: 

Do not initialize gadgets which are not visible on user screen. Initialize them once they become visible.
fields.summary: Dashboards with a large amount of gadgets cause performance degradation in high concurrent access environments

fields.description:

Note that the HTML content is rendered properly in the Custom Field list as shown below:
!proper.PNG|width="100%"!
And other custom fields with html description don't seem to be a problem (I tested multiline text, and select list types)

I found https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28776, however the resolution there is not clear considering that HTML content is still supported on other custom field type description. Perhaps the resolution to that ticket is now obsolete?

  {panel}

Today we see JIRA issues on Calendar plugin marked with different colors, one per issue priority (ONLY). 

The calendar gadget could be much more useful with more choices for the origin of the color lozenges. I would actually like to see the status lozenge in the calendar gadget - to indicate at a glance the STATUS of the various issues on each day in the calendar. 

How about a pulldown menu for a choice of how to display the color lozenges on the calendar gadget?: 

-issue priority (current)
-issue status (status lozenges)
-project (JRA-33108)
fields.summary: Add the ability to choose what colors represent in JIRA Calendar Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37737].
  {panel}

It's not possible to modify the default mail handler as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31858 as the changes revert after maintenance / updates. 

However, adding a second handler that performs a similar function to the default handler also does not work as there is no way to prioritise which mail handler should take precedence over incoming mail. 

For example: A user wants to remove the duplicate text from reply emails before adding the new response text as a comment to an existing issue. 

* "incoming mail handler 1.jpg" shows comment text when both mail handlers are present
* "incoming mail handler 2.jpg" shows *preferred* comment text when default handler has been (temporarily) removed 

An improved behaviour would be to specify a mail handler as the default mail handler to use or to allow permanent changes to the default mail handler.
fields.summary: Default incoming mail handler conflicts with additional handlers

fields.description:
In the online documentation "Managing Global Permissions" located at "https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions" the following quote can be found in the "Explanation" for "JIRA Users":

"The exception to this are groups that also have either the JIRA System Administrators or JIRA Administrators permissions, since JIRA prevents groups with these administrative-level global permissions from being granted the JIRA Users permission."

The goal is to prevent a group from having both "JIRA Users" and administrative-level global permissions at the same time. And, what is explicitly stated in the "Explanation" quote, does work: trying to grant administrative-level global permissions to a group that already has "JIRA Users" global permission is blocked by JIRA (6.2).

However, JIRA does _not_ block the reverse procedure from assigning this combination of permissions! That is, if a group starts with "JIRA Users" global permission granted, it _is_ possible to then grant either of the administrative-level global permissions to that group. Oops!

Amusingly, once you have a group with both "JIRA Users" and an administrative-level global permission granted, then an attempt to (again) grant that same group "JIRA Users" global permission is blocked, even though the group already _has_ "JIRA Users" global permission granted.

Detailed Steps:

- Log into a JIRA 6.2 instance with "JIRA System Administrators" global permission
- Go to "User Management" / "Groups"
- "Add Group" "GROUPA"
- Go to "User Management" / "Global Permissions"

*** demonstrate correct behavior (grant "administrative" then "User" = blocked [correct])
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA System Administrators" to Group "GROUPA"
	> should see "GROUPA" having "JIRA System Administrators" permission
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA Users" to Group "GROUPA"
	> this should be blocked; correct!
- Delete group "GROUPA" from "JIRA System Administrators" permission
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA Administrators" to Group "GROUPA"
	> should see "GROUPA" having "JIRA Administrators" permission
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA Users" to Group "GROUPA"
	> this should be blocked; correct!
- Delete group "GROUPA" from "JIRA Administrators" permission
- At this point group "GROUPA" should not have any global permissions granted

*** demonstrate incorrect behavior (grant "User" then "administrative" = allowed [INCORRECT])
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA Users" to Group "GROUPA"
	> should see "GROUPA" having "JIRA Users" permission
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA System Administrators" to Group "GROUPA"
	> this should be blocked, but it is allowed; INCORRECT!
	> will see "GROUPA" having "JIRA System Administrators" permission also
- Delete group "GROUPA" from "JIRA System Administrators" permission
- "Add Permission" Permission "JIRA Administrators" to Group "GROUPA"
	> this should also be blocked, but it too is allowed; INCORRECT!
	> will see "GROUPA" having "JIRA Administrators" permission also
fields.summary: Administrative global permissions can be added to groups with the JIRA Users global permission

h3. Summary of bug

When the user saves the JIRA Dashboard as a HTML file, at the bottom of the file, there will be a duplicate of the dashboard, with the same gadgets. However, the gadgets would not have any results, but would instead return an error.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Save the Dashboard as a HTML file
# Open the file, and scroll to the bottom
# There will be duplicate dashboard and gadgets :

!Dashboard.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
As I navigate to Jira's website, the following message is shown:

"There is a problem with this website's security certificate. 

The security certificate presented by this website has expired or is not yet valid.

Security certificate problems may indicate an attempt to fool you or intercept any data you send to the server. 
We recommend that you close this webpage and do not continue to this website.

fields.description:
We have two projects, both with Agile Simplified Workflow, but with different sets of statuses. Project A was migrated from classic workflow and we chose to keep its set of statuses (Open, Reopened, In Progress, Resolved, Closed). Project B has statuses To Do, In Progress and Done.

When I try to migrate a story with two sub-tasks (one Resolved, the other Open) from project A to project B, it fails with a "WORKFLOW ASSOCIATION ERROR" with message "Unable to determine the target status for issue", although the new status for all the sub-tasks was supposedly set in step 2 of the move wizard.

If I delete one of the sub-tasks, the move succeeds.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Create a story in the project A with status Open.
2. Create a sub-task AA for the story and change its status to Resolved.
3. Create another sub-task AB for the story. Leave its status as Open.
4. Try to move the story to project B.

*Expected result:*

Story and sub-tasks moved to project B with statuses changed according to what was selected in step 2: Move Issue: Select Status of the Move "wizard".

*Actual result:*

Error screen "WORKFLOW ASSOCIATION ERROR" with message "Unable to determine the target status for issue AA".
fields.summary: Unable to move issue with sub-issues to another project with different workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37716].
  {panel}

With custom user picker fields, you can choose particular people as the default user.

But I would like to be able to have the default user be "the person executing the transition that caused this screen to appear". The default should only be applied if the field is empty upon the transition starting.

Currently I am achieving this using some ajax and javascript code, but it doesn't always work.

I have investigated transition post-functions but they're not ideal, because I want a user to see that they have been set as the value for the field, while also having the option to change it to another value. Using a post-function either over-writes their value, or even if it doesn't, it looks odd to the user to leave a field blank and then have it automatically populated with their name when they click save - better to auto-populate it with their name when the form first loads so there is no confusion about what's happening.
fields.summary: User Picker custom field should have default option of 'Current user'

fields.description:
*Background on the scenario*:
There are a few Security Levels whereby each customer (user or group) belongs to only one level. Therefore, once a customer create an issue, he can set the Security Level for the issue to the level that he is assigned to (to avoid confusion by showing him all the security levels).

Now, when the user tries to add a Custom Field to the security levels, and then add the field to the Create Screen, so that customers can choose not only the security level but also other uses who he might be interested to give him the ability to view the issue.

*Expected Behavior*:
The Create Screen will only show the security level associated with that customer.

*Actual Behavior*:
On the Create Screen, the customer can view all Security Levels which includes that user picker custom field.
fields.summary: Issue Security Levels shows all the levels even with the user belonging to only one level

  {panel}

h4. Summary
The Issue Type helper icon will show all issue types in JIRA, regardless of issue type scheme they are on. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Copy the Default Issue Type Scheme
# Edit the issue type scheme to have only 2 issue types
# Associate it to a new project
# Create new issue
# Click the Helper icon on Create Issue screen. 

h4. Result
You will see all *Issue Types*, *Priority Levels*, *Statuses* and *Resolutions* configured in JIRA

h4. Screenshot
!helper.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Type Helper shows all issue types

fields.description:
Scenario:
Simple project with just 2 (custom) issue types and a field configuration scheme with only the Default entry (i.e. both issue types associated with the same field configuration).
We assume also a user who has access only to this project.
Opening basic searching -> More Criteria and searching for "Component", the (system) field does appear but it cannot be selected (it is greyed out) and an exclamation mark appears next to it.
According to the documentation:
Why is there a red exclamation mark in my field?
Some field values are only valid for a particular project/issue type context. For example, you may have configured a project to use a status In QA Review in its workflow. If you select this project and status in your search, then change the search to filter for a project that doesn't use n QA Review, the status will be invalid and ignored in the search.
If I also select explicitly the project name in the search criteria, then Component does appear and can be selected.
The question is why is it necessary to select also the project name in this case? The above reasoning does not apply.
Please note also that if I switch to Advanced Search and just type Component = xxx, it does work fine.
I believe this is a bug. Could you please try to reproduce it?

PS. The above problem happens also with other system fileds, such as Fix Version for example which also appears greyed out.

Thanks,
Ioannis
fields.summary: system fields greyed out in search screen
